intro: Euphrasia striata, commonly known as the striped eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers with distinctive dark stripes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia striata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
